code: import React from"react";import"./AboutData.css";import{jsx as _jsx,jsxs as _jsxs}from"react/jsx-runtime";function AboutData(){return/*#__PURE__*/_jsxs("div",{className:"about-data",children:[/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("h2",{children:"About This Data"}),/*#__PURE__*/_jsx("p",{className:"about-text",children:"The data collected by our sensors is reported in magnitude per square arcsecond (mag/arcsec\xB2), a standard astronomical unit used to quantify sky brightness. In this scale, higher numerical values indicate darker skies, while lower values correspond to brighter, more light-polluted skies. For reference, a pristine dark sky typically has a measurement around 21.7 to 22.0 mag/arcsec\xB2, whereas urban environments can drop well below 18 mag/arcsec\xB2 due to artificial lighting. Our sensors collect measurements at regular intervals of five minutes, ensuring comprehensive and consistent monitoring to track variations and trends in sky brightness over time."})]});}export default AboutData;
